def_en: The character of a person or place consists of all the qualities they have that make them distinct from other people or places.
If something has a particular character, it has a particular quality.

def_cn: (某地人具有的)特点，特色，特征
def_en: You can use character to refer to the qualities that people from a particular place are believed to have.
You use character to say what kind of person someone is. For example, if you say that someone is a strange character, you mean they are strange.

Your character is your personality, especially how reliable and honest you are. If someone is of good character, they are reliable and honest. If they are of bad character, they are unreliable and dishonest.

def_cn: (坚强的)个性，性格;人格力量
def_en: If you say that someone has character, you mean that they have the ability to deal effectively with difficult, unpleasant, or dangerous situations.

def_cn: (地方的)与众不同之处，特色
def_en: If you say that a place has character, you mean that it has an interesting or unusual quality which makes you notice it and like it.

def_cn: (电影、书、戏剧里的)人物，角色
def_en: The characters in a film, book, or play are the people that it is about.

def_cn: 有趣的人;怪人;滑稽的人
def_en: If you say that someone is a character, you mean that they are interesting, unusual, or amusing.
A character is a letter, number, or other symbol that is written or printed.

def_cn: 符合/不符合…的性格(或特点)
def_en: If someone's actions are in character, they are doing what you would expect them to do, knowing what kind of person they are. If their actions are out of character, they are not doing what you would expect them to do.
